Name:
HMS Hotspur
Trujillo
Builder: Scotts Shipbuilding & Engineering Company, Greenock, Scotland
Fate:
Sold to the Dominican Republic, 23 November 1948
Sold for scrap, 1972
Notes:
Pennant number: H01
Pennant number: D101
Displacement:
1,350 long tons (1,370 t) (standard)
1,883 long tons (1,913 t) (deep load)
Propulsion:
2 shafts, Parsons geared steam turbines
3 Admiralty 3-drum water-tube boilers
Range: 5,530 nmi (10,240 km; 6,360 mi) at 15 knots (28 km/h; 17 mph)
Armament:
4 × 1 - QF 4.7-inch (120 mm) Mk IX guns
2 × 4 - .50 cal machine guns
2 × 4 - 21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
20 × depth charges, 1 rail and 2 throwers
